task.title: Backing up using the CLI
task.shortdesc: As an alternative to performing application backup from the browser interface, you can use the command-line interface (CLI).

taskbody.context: Using the CLI, you can back up your entire system or specify one or more tenant volumes to exclude from the backup. For example, to save resources you might exclude the tenant volume that contains performance data, hbase-master. If you want to create a backup to restore on another system, you might exclude the tenant volumes for the database and index, mariadb-events and zeneventserver.
taskbody.postreq: If you use automated backups, edit to exclude the tenant volumes.
